moves.1. d4 e6 2. e4 c5 3. Nf3 cxd4 4. Nxd4 a6: Based on my experience in this tournament I can not see the exchange benefits black in the long run. White has the bishop pair and strong diagonals to compensate for the pawn.
moves.9... Nxe4 10. Bb4 Qb6 11. c3 e5: This is the little premature. Better is 11. ...Nc6.
moves.12. f3 exd4 13. fxe4: here black is slightly better because of all the pawn weaknesses in whites position.
moves.13... dxc3: As black I would prefer to develop my pieces with 13. ...Nc6.
moves.14. bxc3: Why bxc3 instead of Bxc3? Well because the bishop on b4 prevents black from castling.
moves.14... Qe3: This is a good move by Dcrofut which I did not see coming.
moves.15. Qd3 Qxd3 16. Bxd3: With the queens gone my bishops dominate the board.
moves.16... b5: a good move that restricts the mobility of the bishop
moves.17. Bd6: This ensures that the king stays in the centre. Black is ok because white has two pawn weaknesses.
moves.17... Nc6 18. e5: This prevents Ne5 which is good for black.
moves.18... f6: Bad move! This allows me to create an open file right in from of the King. Better is Bb7 taking control of the long diagonal.
moves.21. Rf2: preparing to double up the rooks on the the F file.
moves.21... h5: opening up access to h6 for the rook.
